message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.MA, cs.DS, cs.AI. 

The paper proposes a novel online learning setting for a profit-maximizing seller to learn customers' preferences through offering recommendations, which involves the use of a sequential multinomial logit (SMNL) model. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. Additionally, the paper deals with the problem of recommending products to customers, which is a common task in Information Retrieval (cs.IR). The paper also proposes a learning algorithm and characterizes the regret bound, which suggests that it may belong to the Multi-Agent Systems (cs.MA) sub-category. The paper also deals with the problem of mitigating risks associated with learning new products, which suggests that it may belong to the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a method for optimizing product recommendations, which suggests that it may belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category.
